SectionBody.Text: The office may require any insurer authorized to write a policy of products liability insurance in the state to transmit the following information, based on its statewide products liability insurance writings. Upon the request of the office, an insurer shall, within 60 days, submit to the office a report that contains:

Subsection.Text: The dollar amount of claims paid;
Incurred claims, not including claims incurred but not reported;
Claims closed without payment, and the amount reserved for such claims;
Loss reserves for all claims except claims incurred but not reported;
Reserves for claims incurred but not reported;
Losses paid as a percentage of the amount reserved for such losses;
Net investment gain or loss and other income gain or loss allocated to products liability lines according to the allocation formula used in the annual insurance expense exhibit;
Actual expenses in detail, including, but not limited to, loss adjustment expense; commissions; general expense; and advertising, home office, and defense costs;
Claims settled after a suit was filed;
Claims paid based on a judgment; and
Judgments appealed by the insurer, together with the total results of such appeals.
